title: Facebook working on cryptocurrency-based payments platform
text: Effort could be crypto’s most mainstream application to date

title: Facebook is reportedly looking for allies to support its planned cryptocurrency payment service
text: Facebook has spoken with various companies, including Visa and MasterCard, about the project, which is known internally as Project Libra, according to the report.

title: Facebook Bans Far-Right Figures for Policy Violations
text: Facebook Inc. said it’s banning a number of controversial far-right figures for violating the social-media company’s policies on hate speech and promoting violence. Bloomberg's Kurt Wagner has more on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Facebook bans extremist leaders for far-right, anti-semitic speech
text: “A New Textbook of Americanism” author Jonathan Hoenig, former investment banker Carol Roth, Kaltbaum Capital Management President Gary Kaltbaum and FBN’s Kristina Partsinevelos on how Facebook banned extremist figures from its website.

title: Instagram's Latest Feature Could Make Insta-Shopping Huge
text: Get ready for more shoppable posts, now featuring your favorite Instagram influencers.

title: Investors focused on Facebook's better monetization, not privacy: Internet analyst
text: FB analyst Mark Mahaney with RBC Capital Markets, discusses what investors are looking for in Facebook.

title: FTC dealing with Facebook could signal vigorous enforcement to come: Pro
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team breaks down the new privacy oversight on the table for Facebook and CEO Mark Zuckerberg with Nancy Scola, Politico technology reporter that broke the story, and Ryan Radia, an adjunct fellow for CEI, a lobbying group promoting limited regulation.

title: Facebook bans a fresh batch of mostly far-right figures
text: Facebook just announced its latest mini-purge of controversial accounts that violate its rules against “dangerous individuals and organizations.” In this round Facebook newly cracked down on Milo Yiannopoulos, Paul Joseph Watson, Laura Loomer, Paul Nehlen, Louis Farrakhan.

title: Takeaways from F8 and Facebook’s next phase
text: Extra Crunch offers members the opportunity to tune into conference calls led and moderated by the TechCrunch writers you read every day. This week, TechCrunch’s Josh Constine and Frederic Lardinois discuss major announcements that came out of Facebook’s F8 conference and dig into how Facebook is trying to redefine itself for the future.

title: Daily Crunch: Facebook shows off an aspirational redesign
text: The Daily Crunch is TechCrunch’s roundup of our biggest and most important stories. If you’d like to get this delivered to your inbox every day at around 9am Pacific, you can subscribe here.

title: High tech needs to work closer with government: Former Cisco CEO
text: Recode editor-at-large Kara Swisher and Cisco former CEO John Chambers join "Squawk Alley" to discuss the future of the internet with A.I. and automation and how to regulate privacy from companies like Facebook.

title: Here are some ways Facebook can address privacy concerns
text: Facebook is reportedly creating a committee to safeguard users' data.

title: Dead Facebook users may outnumber living users by 2070: Study
text: Julie Hyman of Yahoo Finance discusses the the Facebook study by the Oxford Internet Institute, that suggests the amount of dead Facebook users may outnumber the living on the social platform by the year 2070.

title: Facebook settlement with the US reportedly may include a privacy oversight committee
text: Facebook and the Federal Trade Commission are negotiating a possible settlement that would require the company to create an independent privacy oversight committee.
